title: Major League Cricket matches coming to Broward County Stadium in 2025
body:
Professional cricket is making a big play in South Florida. Broward County Parks will host a press conference on Tuesday, April 15, to announce that Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) is bringing matches to Broward County Stadium in July 2025.

The event will feature remarks from Major League Cricket CEO Johnny Grave, Broward County Commissioner Hazelle P. Rogers, and Lauderhill Mayor Denise D. Grant. Dan West, Director of Broward County Parks, will serve as the Master of Ceremonies.

The announcement marks a landmark partnership between MLC and the county, with speakers expected to highlight the projected economic impact, the upcoming match schedule, and cricket’s growing momentum in the United States as the sport gears up for inclusion in the 2028 Olympic Games in Los Angeles.

The press conference is open to media outlets, which are invited to attend and learn more about the role Broward County will play in hosting high-profile cricket events next summer.

Broward County Stadium, located in Lauderhill, is the only dedicated cricket stadium in the United States certified by the International Cricket Council (ICC) and has previously hosted international matches and global tournaments.

summary:
* Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) is bringing matches to Broward County Stadium in Lauderhill, Florida in July 2025.
* A press conference will be held on April 15 to announce this partnership between MLC and Broward County, featuring remarks from MLC CEO Johnny Grave, Broward County Commissioner Hazelle P. Rogers, Lauderhill Mayor Denise D. Grant, and Director of Broward County Parks Dan West.
* The announcement is expected to highlight the projected economic impact, the upcoming match schedule, and cricket's growing momentum in the United States ahead of its inclusion in the 2028 Olympic Games in Los Angeles.
* Broward County Stadium is the only dedicated cricket stadium in the United States certified by the International Cricket Council (ICC) and has previously hosted international matches and global tournaments.

title: Author: Matthew Williams
body:
Major League Cricket extends with Royal, Remitly

Major League Cricket (MLC) has secured sponsorship renewals with digital finance brand Remitly and rice brand Royal ahead of its third season

LG’s ANC tie-up leads to enhanced Red Sox deal

Electronics brand LG has announced an expansion to its agreement with the Boston Red Sox in a deal brokered by venue technology agency ANC.

DoorDash adds pickleball to US sports footprint

On-demand delivery service Doordash has expanded its presence in US sport by taking on presenting sponsorship rights to Major League Pickleball (MLP).

Rewards club at centre of Hilton’s FA sponsorship

Hilton will look to promote its rewards club programme to England football fans as part of a sponsorship of the Football Association (FA) announced today.

Expanded women’s role for Qantas in CA renewal

Qantas will receive women’s team shirt branding for the first time in its latest renewal with Cricket Australia.

EXCLUSIVE: Right Formula adds five clients in F1

Sports marketing agency Right Formula has reinforced its position in the Formula 1 market by securing five new clients, each of which has a presence in the series

Trio of hires for Audi F1 Project

The commercial team behind the Audi F1 Project continues to take shape after a trio of new appointments

SA Rugby says goodbye to MTN after eight years

SA Rugby will undertake a complete overhaul of the Springboks' sponsorship structure after the governing body announced the end of its front-of-shirt deal with telco MTN

EXCLUSIVE: HSBC returns to F1 after 21 years

Global bank HSBC will be visible on a Formula 1 car for the first time since 2004 when its logo joins the Racing Bulls (VCARB) car, SportBusiness understands
summary:
* Major League Cricket (MLC) has secured sponsorship renewals with digital finance brand Remitly and rice brand Royal ahead of its third season.

Note: There is no other information about the Major League Cricket tournament in the article apart from this.

title: MLC reunites with Remitly
body:
Remitly back as Official Partner

The Major League Cricket (MLC) has partnered with digital financial services provider Remitly for a second consecutive season, with the latter joining the league as an Official Partner. Remitly will work on various fan engagement activities across the United States of America (USA) and the partnership will include not only fan engagement initiatives but also promotions and community-driven activations.

The third season of the MLC will kick off from June 2025 with the upcoming season featuring more matches, as MLC 2025 will have a total of 34 games hosted across the three venues in Dallas, Oakland and Broward County.

Johnny Grave, CEO of Major League Cricket, commented,

“We are delighted to continue our partnership with Remitly for Season 3.Our league is built on the support of passionate cricket fans from all over the world, many of whom rely on Remitly’s services to stay connected with their families. This partnership is a natural fit, and we look forward to delivering another thrilling season together.”

Pankaj Sharma, Chief Business Officer, Remitly, said,

“Cricket is more than a game for many of our customers—it’s a meaningful way to build community where they are, while staying connected to loved ones around the world. We are proud to continue our partnership with Cognizant Major League Cricket as it enters its historic third season, bringing the spirit of this global game to fans across the US.”
summary:
* Remitly has partnered with MLC as an Official Partner for the second consecutive season.
* The partnership will involve fan engagement activities, promotions, and community-driven activations across the USA.
* The third season of MLC will start in June 2025 and will feature 34 games hosted across three venues in Dallas, Oakland, and Broward County.
* This partnership aims to cater to the passionate cricket fans from around the world, many of whom rely on Remitly's services to stay connected with their families.
